result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick Ladel Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $0
Pay DNA surcharges;
Pay court costs
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
-  the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain full-time employment.
Obtain a GED/HSED.

No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with the co-actor, no contact with any of the victims of the armed robbery in the Little Whiskey Bar, and not contact with the Little Whiskey Bar.

Cooperate with the Probation Department.
Provide a DNA sample.
Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: Denying Motion for Postconviction Relief
Letter from Attorney Ellen Henak supplementing postconviction motion.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, Br. 19, for review. jbs

Per order dated May 4, 2018, Appeal No. 2016XX918-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the deadline for Lewis to file a postconviction motion or a notice of appeal is extended through June 4, 2018.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.82(2)(a)(2015-16).
Fourth Motion to Extend Time for Filing Post-Conviction Motion or Notice of Appeal, received.

per order dated March 20, 2018, Appeal No. 2016XX918-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the deadline for Lewis to file a postconviction motion or a notice of appeal is extended through May 3, 2018. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.82(2)(a) (2015-16).
Third Motion to Extend Time for Filing Post-Conviction Motion or Notice of Appeal, received.
Per order dated January 31, 2018, Appeal No. 2016XX918-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the deadline for Lewis to file a postconviction motion or notice of appeal in this matter is extended to March 19, 2018.
Second Motion to Extend Time for Filing Post-Conviction Motion or Notice of Appeal, received.

Per Order Dated November 30, 2017, Appeal No. 2017XX918-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the deadline for Lewis to file a postconviction motion or notice of appeal in this matter is extended to January 30, 2018.
Motion to Extend Time for Filing Post-Conviction Motion or Notice of Appeal, received.

Denying Motion to Withdraw as Counsel signed
For Defendant's Response
State Public Defender Report received and filed.
State Public Defender Report

per order dated October 02, 2017, Appeal No. 2016XX918CR, IT IS ORDERED that the State's response is accepted as filed. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the deadline for Lewis to file a postconviction motion or a notice of appeal in this matter is extended though December 01, 2017.

per order dated September 15, 2017, Appeal No. 2016XX918CR, IT IS ORDERED that the motion to extend the time for filing a postconviction motion or notice of appeal is held in abeyance pending further order of this court. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that within five days of the date of this order, counsel for Lewis shall serve the State with a copy of his motion, and certify such service to this court. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that within fourteen days of the date on which the State is served with a copy of counsel's motion, the State shall inform this court whether it opposes Lewis's motion and, if so, on what grounds.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, Br. 19, for review. mag

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (24 pages) commencing 12-10-15 SENTENCING HEARING  received and filed.
ORDER TO PRODUCE    RECEIVED AND FILED

Defendant Patrick Ladel Lewis in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Patrick Ladel Lewis in custody.  Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State has complied with victim rights.  Court reviewed the pre-sentence report filed by the defense.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  7.5 YEARS/MONTHS with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.
Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.

  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- No possession or use of alcohol or illegal drugs
- Random urine screens
- Seek and maintain full-time employment
- Obtain a GED/HSED
- No contact with the co-actor, no contact with any of the victims of the armed robbery in the Little Whiskey Bar, and not contact with the Little Whiskey Bar
- Provide a DNA sample.
 Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $0
Pay DNA surcharges;
Pay court costs
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
-  the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.    Signed INELIGIBLE VOTING NOTICE & ACKNOWLEDGMENT provided to defendant.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Patrick Ladel Lewis in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Patrick Ladel Lewis in custody.  Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense counsel withdraws its motion to withdraw as counsel.  Defense counsel makes a record of events regarding the motions to withdraw as counsel.
by defense counsel, received and filed
received and filed from defendant
List of Witnesses filed by Atty. Thomas E. Harris.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions filed by Atty. Thomas E. Harris.
Motion In Limine Filed by Atty. Thomas E. Harris.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Patrick Ladel Lewis not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Patrick Ladel Lewis not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Demand For Discovery And Inspection filed by Attorney Thomas E. Harris.

Defendant Patrick Ladel Lewis in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Patrick Ladel Lewis in custody.  Irene Parthum for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Gregg W.; Little Whiskey Bar; April K.; Cheryl K. or their residences or Co-Defendant Tremain Jones

Defendant Patrick Ladel Lewis in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Patrick Ladel Lewis in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
